title: How to create and edit a license pool
content:
Create a license pool

  1. From the main menu, click License-pools.
  2. Click New.
  3. Enter the name and description.
  4. Click Save.

Edit a license pool

  1. From the main menu, select License-pools.
  2. Click the license pool in the ID column to display the selected license pool.
  3. Click the tab you want to view or edit. See the License pool details section below. The General tab is displayed by default.
  4. Save the changes.

License pool details

  • General tab

    Field Description
    ID License pool ID.
    Name License pool name.
    Description

    Description of the license pool.

  • Licenses tab

    This tab displays the licenses added to this pool. For more information on licenses, see Licenses.

  • Assignments tab

    This tab displays the assignments of this license pool.

    To add an assignment, click Add, select a license to get the remaining capacity, and then you can assign the available capacity to the tenant that you select. You can also click Revoke to revoke licenses.

    Notes

    • The maximum capacity (sum of the current capacity and future capacity) that you can assign to a trial tenant is 10. For example, if the current capacity of a trial tenant is 3, you can further assign a capacity of no more than 7 to this tenant.
    • It's not supported to assign both the Premium and Express licenses to the same tenant. 

  • Tenants tab

    This tab displays the tenants assigned with licenses in this pool. For more information, see Tenants.

License pool status

You can change license pool status between Active and Inactive manually.

Status Description
Active Licenses can be added to an Active license pool.
Inactive Licenses can't be added to an Inactive license pool.

Delete a license pool

Notes
  • You can only delete an empty license pool (which has an empty Licenses tab). 
  • Once you have assigned a license to a tenant, you can no longer delete the associated license pool, even after you revoke the license assignment and move the license to another license pool (by changing the License pool field value of the license record). This design is to ensure the system can keep a full history of all license assignments, which are based on license pools.
  • If you no longer need a license pool, you can revoke all license assignments associated with it, and then set it to Inactive. 

To delete an empty license pool:

  1. From the main menu, select License-pools.
  2. Select the license pool you want to delete.
  3. Click Delete on the toolbar.
  4. Click OK.
